access.description: Set to be true in order to install the Access Control policy. By default, the value is true if Access Control policy is enabled on the input policy package, otherwise false.

desktop_security.description: Set to be true in order to install the Desktop Security policy. By default, the value is true if desktop security policy is enabled on the input policy package, otherwise false.

install_on_all_cluster_members_or_fail.description: Relevant for the gateway clusters. If true, the policy is installed on all the cluster members. If the installation on a cluster member fails, don't install on that cluster.

policy_package.description: The name of the Policy Package to be installed.

prepare_only.description: If true, prepares the policy for the installation, but doesn't install it on an installation target.

qos.description: Set to be true in order to install the QoS policy. By default, the value is true if Quality-of-Service policy is enabled on the input policy package, otherwise false.

revision.description: The UID of the revision of the policy to install.

targets.description: On what targets to execute this command. Targets may be identified by their name, or object unique identifier.

threat_prevention.description: Set to be true in order to install the Threat Prevention policy. By default, the value is true if Threat Prevention policy is enabled on the input policy package, otherwise false.

continue_last_session.description: When 'continue-last-session' is set to 'True', the new session would continue where the last session was stopped. enter_last_published_session.description: Login to the last published session. Such login is done with the Read Only permissions.

read_only.description: Login with Read Only permissions. This parameter is not considered in case continue-last-session is true.

session_timeout.description: Session expiration timeout in seconds. Default 600 seconds.

accept_replies.description: Specifies whether Other Service replies are to be accepted.

action.description: Contains an INSPECT expression that defines the action to take if a rule containing this service is matched. Example: set r_mhandler &open_ssl_handler sets a handler on the connection.

aggressive_aging.description: Sets short (aggressive) timeouts for idle connections.

This overrides the settings in the Connection Persistence page. If you change this property, the change will not affect open connections, but only future connections.

match.description: Contains an INSPECT expression that defines the matching criteria. The connection is examined against the expression during the first packet. Example: tcp, dport = 21, direction = 0 matches incoming FTP control connections.

match_for_any.description: Indicates whether this service is used when 'Any' is set as the rule's service and there are several service objects with the same source port and protocol.

override_default_settings.description: Indicates whether this service is a Data Domain service which has been overridden.

session_timeout.description: Time (in seconds) before the session times out.

This overrides the settings in the Connection Persistence page. If you change this property, the change will not affect open connections, but only future connections.

match_by_protocol_signature.description: A value of true enables matching by the selected protocol's signature - the signature identifies the protocol as genuine. Select this option to limit the port to the specified protocol. If the selected protocol does not support matching by signature, this field cannot be set to true.

match_for_any.description: Indicates whether this service is used when 'Any' is set as the rule's service and there are several service objects with the same source port and protocol.

name.description: Object name. Should be unique in the domain.

override_default_settings.description: Indicates whether this service is a Data Domain service which has been overridden.

port.description: The number of the port used to provide this service. To specify a port range, place a hyphen between the lowest and highest port numbers, for example 44-55.

protocol.description: Select the protocol type associated with the service, and by implication, the management server (if any) that enforces Content Security and Authentication for the service. Selecting a Protocol Type invokes the specific protocol handlers for each protocol type, thus enabling higher level of security by parsing the protocol, and higher level of connectivity by tracking dynamic actions (such as opening of ports).

session_timeout.description: Time (in seconds) before the session times out.

source_port.description: Port number for the client side service. If specified, only those Source port Numbers will be Accepted, Dropped, or Rejected during packet inspection. Otherwise, the source port is not inspected.

sync_connections_on_cluster.description: Enables state-synchronized High Availability or Load Sharing on a ClusterXL or OPSEC-certified cluster.

aggressive_aging.description: Sets short (aggressive) timeouts for idle connections.

color.description: Color of the object. Should be one of existing colors.

ignore_errors.description: Apply changes ignoring errors. You won't be able to publish such a changes. If ignore-warnings flag was omitted - warnings will also be ignored.

keep_connections_open_after_policy_insta.description: Keep connections open after policy has been installed even if they are not allowed under the new policy. This overrides the settings in the Connection Persistence page. If you change this property, the change will not affect open connections, but only future connections.

match_by_protocol_signature.description: A value of true enables matching by the selected protocol's signature - the signature identifies the protocol as genuine. Select this option to limit the port to the specified protocol. If the selected protocol does not support matching by signature, this field cannot be set to true.

match_for_any.description: Indicates whether this service is used when 'Any' is set as the rule's service and there are several service objects with the same source port and protocol.

name.description: Object name. Should be unique in the domain.

override_default_settings.description: Indicates whether this service is a Data Domain service which has been overridden.

port.description: The number of the port used to provide this service. To specify a port range, place a hyphen between the lowest and highest port numbers, for example 44-55.

protocol.description: Select the protocol type associated with the service, and by implication, the management server (if any) that enforces Content Security and Authentication for the service. Selecting a Protocol Type invokes the specific protocol handlers for each protocol type, thus enabling higher level of security by parsing the protocol, and higher level of connectivity by tracking dynamic actions (such as opening of ports).

session_timeout.description: Time (in seconds) before the session times out.

source_port.description: Port number for the client side service. If specified, only those Source port Numbers will be Accepted, Dropped, or Rejected during packet inspection. Otherwise, the source port is not inspected.

sync_connections_on_cluster.description: Enables state-synchronized High Availability or Load Sharing on a ClusterXL or OPSEC-certified cluster.

accepted_api_calls_from.description: Clients allowed to connect to the API Server.

automatic_start.description: MGMT API will start after server will start.

keep_sessions_by_count.description: Whether or not to keep the latest N sessions. Note: when the automatic purge feature is enabled, this field and/or the "keep-sessions-by-date" field must be set to 'true'.

keep_sessions_by_days.description: Whether or not to keep the sessions for D days. Note: when the automatic purge feature is enabled, this field and/or the "keep-sessions-by-count" field must be set to 'true'.

number_of_days_to_keep.description: When "keep-sessions-by-days = true" this sets the number of days to keep the sessions.

number_of_sessions_to_keep.description: When "keep-sessions-by-count = true" this sets the number of newest sessions to preserve, by the sessions's publish date.

scheduling.description: When to purge sessions that do not meet the "keep" criteria. Note: when the automatic purge feature is enabled, this field must be set.

servers.description: Multi Domain Servers. When the field is provided, 'set-global-domain' command is executed asynchronously.

tags.description: Collection of tag identifiers. Note: The list of tags can not be modified in a singlecommand together with the domain servers. To modify tags, please use the separate 'set-global-domain' command, without providing the list of domain servers.

follow_up.description: Tag the protection with pre-defined follow-up flag.

custom_header.description:
When set to false, The admin is not using Key and Value for a Custom Header in order to connect to the feed server.

When set to true, The admin is using Key and Value for a Custom Header in order to connect to the feed server.

custom_key.description: Key for the Custom Header, relevant and required only when custom_header set to true.

custom_value.description: Value for the Custom Header, relevant and required only when custom_header set to true.

interval.description: Update interval of the feed in seconds.

name.description: Object name. Must be unique in the domain.

url.description: URL of the JSON feed (e.g. https://example.com/file.json).

enforce_gtp.description: Enable enforce GTP signal packet rate limit from this group.

keep_connections_open_after_policy_insta.description: Keep connections open after policy has been installed even if they are not allowed under the new policy. This overrides the settings in the Connection Persistence page. If you change this property, the change will not affect open connections, but only future connections.

filter.description: Search expression to filter objects by. The provided text should be exactly the same as it would be given in Smart Console. The logical operators in the expression ('AND', 'OR') should be provided in capital letters. By default, the search involves both a textual search and a IP search. To use IP search only, set the "ip-only" parameter to true.

from.description: From which element number the query was done.

ip_only.description: If using "filter", use this field to search objects by their IP address only, without involving the textual search.

limit.description: The maximal number of returned results.

offset.description: Number of the results to initially skip.

to.description: To which element number the query was done.

total.description: Total number of elements returned by the query.

type.description: The objects' type, e.g.: host, service-tcp, network, address-range...

asc.description: Sorts results by the given field in ascending order.

desc.description: Sorts results by the given field in descending order.

filter.description: Return results matching the specified filter.
